prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Create a circle centered at [0.375, 0.375] with a radius of 0.375 on the XY plane. This forms loop 1, which is the only loop on face 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.2083 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. This completes the construction of the cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. **Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom, Joined to Part 1** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.1167, 0.1167, 0.2083]. Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Create a circle centered at [0.2583, 0.2583] with a radius of 0.2583 on the XY plane. This forms loop 1, which is the only loop on face 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5167. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.2917 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Join the extruded 3D sketch to part 1 using the "JoinFeatureOperation" boolean operation. This completes the construction of the second cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, joined to the first. The final shape of the assembly is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, where the height of the cylinder is approximately twice the diameter and the object is symmetrical along its central axis.</description>
